item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Wednesday, September 11, 2024 at 4:20 PM UTC
item.description:

2. AppleWatchAmmeter (91 points | 12 comments)
3. Max Headroom and the World of Pseudo-CGI (2013) (60 points | 18 comments)

7. The Golden Road: How Ancient India Transformed the World (29 points | 5 comments)
8. Binsider – A TUI for analyzing Linux binaries (64 points | 11 comments)
9. How to make a table row a link (2020) (8 points | 3 comments)
10. Soft Cells and the Geometry of Seashells (8 points | discuss)
11. How economical is your local Taco Bell? (185 points | 201 comments)
12. Boar's Head plant posed an 'imminent threat' years before listeria outbreak (40 points | 26 comments)
13. Show HN: Clace – Application Server with support for scaling down to zero (10 points | 2 comments)
14. Possibly all the ways to get loop-finding in graphs wrong (129 points | 24 comments)
15. Google Illuminate: Books and papers turned into audio (589 points | 218 comments)

18. Device Tree Patches Posted for Review to Boot Linux on Apple A7 to A11 Devices (26 points | 3 comments)
19. Breaking Bell's Inequality with Monte Carlo Simulations in Python (70 points | 25 comments)
20. Ask HN: Why no transflective LCD portables? (34 points | 24 comments)
21. Openly Licensed Streetview with Panoramax (36 points | 8 comments)
22. Chai-1: Decoding the molecular interactions of life (251 points | 62 comments)
23. Consent-O-Matic – automatically fills ubiquitous pop-ups with your preferences (205 points | 94 comments)
24. Some of us like "interdiff" code review (159 points | 118 comments)
25. New York Times tech workers union votes to authorize a strike (394 points | 401 comments)
26. New Feature Alert: Access Archived Webpages Directly Through Google Search (12 points | 2 comments)
27. Why Not Comments (214 points | 209 comments)
28. Microwave spontaneously turned on by its LED display (138 points | 85 comments)
29. Neanderthals' social isolation may have sped up their extinction (7 points | 1 comment)
30. Tutorial on diffusion models for imaging and vision (202 points | 15 comments)
